in_ports.name: input
in_ports.caption: external input
in_ports.hint:
One of input ports of the chain.
When specified, this function simply returns a copy of this image (other arguments are ignored).

in_ports.name: file
in_ports.caption: subfolder
in_ports.hint: [Optional] String path to the folder.  If specified, it is used instead of "Subfolder" parameter (with all replacements performed in that parameter).

out_ports.name: absolute_path
out_ports.caption: absolute path
out_ports.hint: Actual full absolute path to the subfolder

out_ports.name: parent_folder
out_ports.caption: parent folder
out_ports.hint: Absolute path to the parent folder of the subfolder

controls.caption: Subfolder
controls.name: file
controls.description:
Subfolder (not file!) containing AlgART multi-matrix.
You can use here relative paths (without starting "/" or "c:\"), for example, "test" or "images/test". They will be resolved relative the current folder, containing the executed chain.
If this path starts with substring %TEMP%, %TEMP%/ or %TEMP%x. where x is OS-depended file separator character, this substring is replaced with the full path to the system temp directory (System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir")) with ending file separator. For example, it is correct to write here %TEMP%my_folder, %TEMP%/my_folder or (in Windows) %TEMP%\my_folder.
Also you can use in this string Java system properties: "${name}", for example: "${java.io.tmpdir}", and executor system properties "${path.name.ext}", "${path.name}", "${file.name.ext}", "${file.name}", "${resources}" (chain path/file name with/without extension, resource folder of the platform, containing this function).
